result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory D Wilson

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

4:18 PM Defendant Gregory D Wilson in court.  Attorney Devonte Williams in court for Gregory D Wilson.  Attorney Tomas Valerio in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State moves to find counts 1 and 2 transactionally related. DE states no objection. Court does so find. State calls witness officer A. P., who is duly sworn and testified. Atty. Valerio with direct. Witness identified DE in courtroom. Atty. Windham with cross. State moves for bind over, reserves argument. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds PC for BO to branch.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM . Defendant Gregory D Wilson in court.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Gregory D Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

01:53 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
